page.title: 09Hellesdon Many Years Ago
page.content: An 70 year old resident of Hellesdon gave us this report: "Hellesdon was a large unspoilt County Parish when I was a boy.The population was about 1,000.Reepham road was just a cart track ,it was a large agricultural district.The chief crops were wheat, barley,kale and rye.There were no schools in Hellesdon to begin with.The first school here was Heather Avenue. previous to that there was a school on the Aylsham Road boundary where there was a pond and a water trough for horses to drink from. There were a few old houses in Middletons lane and a pond at the corner of what is now Windsor Road and a large number of greenhouses on the corner. There were also some brickworks just off Middletons Lane".
